ruleset.name: Spryker PHPMD rule set
ruleset.description: Spryker Php Mess Detector rule set

rule.name: NumberOfChildren
rule.message: The {0} {1} has {2} children. Consider to rebalance this class hierarchy to keep number of children under {3}.
rule.description: A class with an excessive number of children is an indicator for an unbalanced class hierarchy. You should consider to refactor this class hierarchy.

property.name: minimum
property.description: Maximum number of acceptable child classes.

rule.name: CouplingBetweenObjects
rule.message: The class {0} has a coupling between objects value of {1}. Consider to reduce the number of dependencies under {2}.
rule.description: A class with too many dependencies has negative impacts on several quality aspects of a class. This includes quality criteria like stability, maintainability and understandability

rule.name: TooManyMethods
rule.message: The {0} {1} has {2} non-getter- and setter-methods. Consider refactoring {1} to keep number of methods under {3}.
rule.description:
A class with too many methods is probably a good suspect for refactoring, in order to reduce its complexity and find a way to have more fine grained objects.
By default it ignores methods starting with 'get' or 'set'.
The default was changed from 10 to 25 in PHPMD 2.3.

rule.name: TooManyPublicMethods
rule.message: The {0} {1} has {2} public methods. Consider refactoring {1} to keep number of public methods under {3}.
rule.description:
A class with too many public methods is probably a good suspect for refactoring, in order to reduce its complexity and find a way to have more fine grained objects.
By default it ignores methods starting with 'get' or 'set'.

rule.name: ShortVariable
rule.message: Avoid variables with short names like {0}. Configured minimum length is {1}.
rule.description: Detects when a field, local, or parameter has a very short name.

property.name: minimum
property.description: Minimum length for a variable, property or parameter name

rule.name: CamelCaseMethodName
rule.message: The method {0} is not named in camelCase.
rule.description: It is considered best practice to use the camelCase notation to name methods.

property.name: allow-underscore
property.description: Allow an optional, single underscore at the beginning.

property.name: allow-underscore-test
property.description: Is it allowed to have underscores in test method names.
